longm = 18 | longs = 37 | longEW = W | coordinates_display=% <!-- Area/postal codes & others --> |postal_code_type = [[ZIP code]] |postal_code = 03784 |area_code = [[Area code 603|603]] |blank_name = [[Geographic Names Information System|GNIS]] feature ID |blank_info = 870780<ref>{{cite gnis|870780|West Lebanon}}</ref> |blank1_name = |blank1_info = |website = |footnotes = }} '''West Lebanon''' is a district (pop. approx 3,500) within the city of [[Lebanon, New Hampshire|Lebanon]], [[New Hampshire]], on the [[Connecticut River]]. The area contains a major shopping plaza strip along [[New Hampshire Route 12A]], serving the [[Upper Valley (Connecticut River)|Upper Valley]] communities along Interstates [[Interstate 89|89]] and [[Interstate 91|91]]. West Lebanon also hosts the [[Lebanon Municipal Airport (New Hampshire)|Lebanon Municipal Airport]], a number of small software and tech businesses, and a regional daily newspaper, the ''[[Valley News]]''. The village, referred to by locals as "West Leb", serves as a bedroom community for nearby [[Dartmouth College]]. West Lebanon was the site of Lebanon's first settlement in 1761. Later the village became a regionally important [[rail transport|rail hub]], although at that time it was better known to rail travelers as Westboro. By the 1950s, however, the rail industry had shrunk significantly. The village of [[White River Junction, Vermont]], across the Connecticut River, took most of the remaining services, and the rail service through West Lebanon was terminated.{{Citation needed|date=April 2012}} Today commerce has replaced transportation as the basis of the economy, and West Lebanon serves as the commercial hub for a [[United States micropolitan area]] of over 170,000 people.<ref> [http://www.census.gov/population/estimates/metro-city/0312mcsa.txt U.S. Bureau of the Census: Official List of Micropolitan Statistical Areas and Components, December 2003]</ref> [[Seminary Hill School]] is located in the area. ==References== {{reflist}} [[Image:White River Junction, VT (Geo. E. Norris print, 1889).jpg|thumb|left|250px|West Lebanon in 1889]] {{Grafton County, New Hampshire}} [[Category:Populated places in Grafton County, New Hampshire]] [[Category:Unincorporated communities in New Hampshire]] [[Category:Populated places on the Connecticut River]] [[Category:Lebanon, New Hampshire]] {{NewHampshire-geo-stub}}
